metadata.feature_description: Applies content workflow settings to templates for approval processes

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Access Templates feature and retrieve available workflows

steps.expected: Templates page loads and shows existing templates
steps.actual: Templates page loaded successfully showing 3 existing templates (Cavalier - Main, Test Template Page, Test Template Valid)

steps.expected: Add Template form appears with template name, description, and template selector
steps.actual: Add Template form appeared with all expected fields. Network request confirmed GetWorkflows API was called and returned 200 OK

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create template with default workflow applied

steps.action: Enter template name 'Workflow Test Template' and description
steps.actual: Template name and description entered successfully. Cavalier - Main template selected by default

steps.action: Click Create button to save template
steps.expected: Template is created successfully with workflow applied
steps.actual: Template created successfully. Network requests confirmed: SavePageDetails API returned 200 OK (with workflowId in request), SavePagePermissions returned 200 OK. New template 'Workflow Test Template' now visible in templates list

observations: The workflow integration operates automatically in the background - there is no explicit UI for selecting workflows when creating templates. The code in templatesCreateManager.js (line 261) automatically assigns the default workflow ID to new templates before saving.
The GetWorkflows API endpoint (TemplatesController.cs lines 86-90) returns available workflows and marks which one is the default using TabWorkflowSettings.Instance.GetDefaultTabWorkflowId().
Network monitoring confirmed the workflow API calls: GetWorkflows returned 200 OK when the Add Template form loaded, and SavePageDetails included the workflowId when creating the template.
